subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text:
* The Japanese representative glyph for this codepoint in Unicode has {{l|ja|⿳[[爫]][[土]][[夂]]}} with 10 strokes as the bottom component. However, the character used in the {{w|Dai Kan-Wa Jiten}} is composed of {{l|ja||⿱[[日]][[爰]]}}, with 9 strokes for the component {{l|ja|爰}} below the {{l|ja|日}} radical.

* This character is not to be confused with <big>{{ja-r|暖|だん}}</big> ("[[warmth]]"), which has the same components but is ordered differently ({{l|ja||⿰[[日]][[爰]]}}) and has different pronunciations and meanings.
